conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 60 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>

<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 60 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>

<reason> I will start by proposing to sell the item X for 60 ZUP since that is what it cost me to produce it. I want to at least break even. </reason>

<player answer> PROPOSE </player answer>  

<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 60 </newly proposed trade>

<message> Hello! I am looking to sell this item X that I have. It cost me 60 ZUP to produce it originally, so I'd like to sell it for that much to at least break even. Please let me know if you are interested at that price or would like to counter offer. </message>

<other player message> I understand that you want to break even on your costs, but I value the resource X at a maximum of 40 ZUP. I believe this is a fair price considering the market value and my budget constraints. Would you consider accepting 40 ZUP for the resource? </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>

<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 60 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>

<reason> The other player is offering 40 ZUP, which is lower than my break even price. However, I'd like to try to make a deal instead of rejecting outright. I still need to cover my costs, so I will counter propose selling for 50 ZUP, which is in between our original offers. </reason>

<player answer> PROPOSE </player answer>

<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>

<message> I understand you have a budget to work within. I still need to try and cover my original costs, but I'm willing to come down on my asking price. Would you be agreeable to purchasing the resource X for 50 ZUP instead of my original ask of 60? Let me know if that works for you or if you would have another counter offer. </message>

<other player message> I appreciate your willingness to negotiate the price. My budget is very tight, and I must stick close to it. However, I would like to propose a middle ground and offer you 45 ZUP for resource X. This is a bit more than I initially planned, but I hope it demonstrates my interest in reaching a fair agreement. Can we settle on 45 ZUP? </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSE </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>

<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>

<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 60 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>

<reason> The other player has come up from their initial offer of 40 to 45 ZUP. While this is still below my ideal price to break even, it shows they are willing to negotiate. I think 45 ZUP is a reasonable compromise, so I will accept their offer. </reason>

<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>

<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

<message> I agree, 45 ZUP seems like a fair middle ground that works for both of our needs. I accept your offer of 45 ZUP for resource X. Pleasure doing business with you! </message>
